data.text:
By Waxperts

When:

Monday 9th of September

Duration:

1 day, 9.45am – 1.30pm

Location:

Waxperts

2A Convent Rd, Dún Laoghaire, Dublin, A96 W7C5

Cost:

Image Skillnet member price: €210

Non-Member Ticket Price: €299

“Cancellation/Rescheduling Policy: If a therapist or model cannot make the training date, Waxperts need at least 2 weeks’ (10 working days) notice from the training date. If this sufficient notice is given, the training date may then be rescheduled or 50% of the cost refunded. If training is cancelled without this notice, there will be no refund.”

Requirements

This course is aimed at qualified beauty therapists with a pre-existing waxing qualification who would like to up-skill their waxing knowledge and techniques. It is also aimed at waxers who want to deliver a more comfortable treatment to their clients.

Learners will need to already have a basic waxing qualification to take part in the Waxperts Conversion Course i.e.: ITEC, CIBTAC, CIDESCO, or VTCT.

Learners will need to bring a model with them on the day with sufficient hair growth in the relevant areas. They do not need to bring any equipment or supplies as this is all available to use on the day in the Waxperts Academy.

Course Overview

Transform regular bikini waxing skills to a Waxperts standard! This course covers client care, positioning, aftercare, hygiene standards, and product knowledge. It includes tuition on female intimate bikini waxing – 5 styles (basic, extended, inbetweeney, brazilian and hollywood). The course is taught through verbal instruction, practical demonstrations, practical work from learners on a model, and some online material and video tutorials. The learner will also have ongoing support from a Waxperts educator.

Course Content

Chapter 1: What is Waxperts Wax?

Where it all began

The ‘Waxperts Way’

The product range

Chapter 2: Waxing

What is waxing?

Hot Wax

Strip Wax

Chapter 3: Anatomy and Physiology of the Hair

Structure of the hair

Function of the hair

Factors that affect hair growth

Clients with excessive hair growth

Chapter 4: Before a Waxperts Wax

Client consultation

Contraindications

Infection control and hygiene

Double-dipping

Waxing equipment

Health and safety

Client positioning

Chapter 5: Waxperts Original Hot Wax Treatments

Waxperts Original Hot Wax

What areas you will wax using Waxperts Hot Wax

What you will need for a Waxperts Hot Wax treatment

Timings you will need for each Waxperts Hot Wax treatment

Waxperts Hot Wax Application and Removal

A Waxperts Bikini Wax

Bikini Types

Chapter 6: Aftercare Advice

Facial aftercare advice

Underarm aftercare advice

Leg aftercare advice

Bikini aftercare advice

Chapter 7: Side Effects of Waxing

Erythema

Folliculitis

Ingrown hairs

Waxperts Wonder Pads

Chapter 8: Waxperts FAQ’s

Chapter 9: Welcome To The Waxperts Family

Branding

Professionalism

Treatments

Pricing

Learning Outcomes

Learners should be able to carry out a safe, hygienic and pain free waxing treatment using the Waxperts wax technique with the Waxperts Waxing system. They should also know;

What is Waxperts Wax.

What is Waxing.

Anatomy and Physiology of the Hair

Before a Waxperts Wax

Client consultation

Contraindications

Infection Control and Hygiene

Double-dipping

Waxing equipment

Health and Safety

Client positioning

Waxperts Original Hot Wax Treatments

Aftercare Advice

Side effects of waxing

Qualifications

AIT accredited . Upon successful completion, a Waxperts Certificate of Attendance/Completion will be awarded.

For more information, or if you need help in booking on to this course, contact us at info@imageskillnet.ie or 071-9640438. Course must be fully paid for in advance of the start date.
